description: This alarm indicates that the operState of the ANCP instance has gone down.

Summary.eval: ($v4==5) ? 'ANCP instance is up' : 'ANCP instance is down'

tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpLinkDown SHE-ALARMING-MIB::sheAlarmTimeAndDate t 31536000 SHE-ALARMING-MIB::sheAlarmReportingSource u 9999 SHE-ALARMING-MIB::sheAlarmReportingSourceType i 1 SHE-ALARMING-MIB::sheAlarmSeverity i 2

$SNMPTRAPCMD SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpLinkDown SHE-ALARMING-MIB::sheAlarmTimeAndDate t 31536000 SHE-ALARMING-MIB::sheAlarmReportingSource u 9999 SHE-ALARMING-MIB::sheAlarmReportingSourceType i 1 SHE-ALARMING-MIB::sheAlarmSeverity i 5

description: Indicates the time stamp when the alarm notification was sent.
variables.name: SHE-ALARMING-MIB::sheAlarmTimeAndDate

description: If applicable, indicates which instance of a component is
reporting the alarm. It is interpreted dependent on the
variables.name: SHE-ALARMING-MIB::sheAlarmReportingSource

description: Indicates the type or class of reporting source for the alarm.
Reporting source type determines how sheAlarmReportingSource
is to be interpreted. See sheAlarmReportingSourceType for a
A sheAlarmSeverityProfileEntry can be assigned to each
sheAlarmReportingSourceType within the MIB associated with
variables.name: SHE-ALARMING-MIB::sheAlarmReportingSourceType

description: Values 1..4 indicate that the alarm of the given severity has
been raised, the actual severity used being dependent on the
Value 5 indicates that the alarm has been cleared.
variables.name: SHE-ALARMING-MIB::sheAlarmSeverity

description: Alarmtrap (warning), that the configured AccessNodeIdentfier together with the mandatory
parameters of the port name could possibly exceed the maximal length of the port name.

Summary.eval: ($v4==5) ? 'Port name complies with length restriction' : 'Port name may exceed maximal length'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpIfCreated SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpControlTimeStamp i 9999 SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpOperState i 1 SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpTimer1 i 1 SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpTimer2 i 0 SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpTimer3 i 0 SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpControllerIpAddress s EXAM SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpAccessNodeIdentifier s EXAMPLE SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpAdjacencyState i 1 SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpPartitionId i 0 SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpAlarmSeverityIndex i 1 SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpLinePropertySuboptions b 0 SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpInterfaceOptions b 0 SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpVlanId u 1 SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpProtocolVersion i 1 SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpSenderNameOption i 1 SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpCustomSenderName s EXAMPL

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpControlTimeStamp

description: The operational state of the ANCP interface.
variables.name: SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpOperState

description: This timer defines the TIMER field is used to inform the receiver of the timer
value used in the adjacency protocol of the sender.
The timer specifies the nominal time between periodic
It is a constant for the duration of a session.
variables.name: SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpTimer1

description: This value defines the minimum time between two port state messages of
the same port. It is used to limit the port messages in case of
0 means: all port state changes are reported.
variables.name: SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpTimer2

description: This timeout is used to handle ANCP message flooding after Controller recovery.
The timer is started when the link to the controller was established, The first
port state message is sent when this timer expires.
variables.name: SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpTimer3

description: The IP address of the remote ANCP controller which should be contacted by this interface.
variables.name: SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpControllerIpAddress

description: The name of the access node. The DSLAM identifies itself with the
controller by means of this name.
variables.name: SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpAccessNodeIdentifier

description: The state of the adjacency protocol.
variables.name: SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpAdjacencyState

description: The ID of the partition managed via this ANCP instance.
The port is managed by ANCP interface instances assigned
The port belongs to no partition. It is managed by ANCP
interface instances which are assigned to 'no partition'.
The port is not managed by any ANCP instance.
variables.name: SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpPartitionId

description: The currently used alarm severity profile index for this ANCP interface.
variables.name: SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpAlarmSeverityIndex

description: This parameter enables/disables the used line property suboptions for this ANCP interface.
Each requested suboption should be enabled by setting the corresponding BIT to 1.
actualDataRateUs(0) 0x81 Actual Data Rate Upstream ok ok
actualDataRateDs(1) 0x82 Actual Data Rate Downstream ok ok
minimumDataRateUs(2) 0x83 Minimum Data Rate Upstream ok ok
minimumDataRateDs(3) 0x84 Minimum Data Rate Downstream ok ok
attainableDataRateUs(4) 0x85 Attainable Data Rate Upstream ok ok
attainableDataRateDs(5) 0x86 Attainable Data Rate Downstream ok ok
maximumDataRateUs(6) 0x87 Maximum Data Rate Upstream ok ok
maximumDataRateDs(7) 0x88 Maximum Data Rate Downstream ok ok
minimumDataRateLowPowerUs(8) 0x89 Minimum Data Rate Upstream in Low Power State ok n/a
minimumDataRateLowPowerDs(9) 0x8A Minimum Data Rate Downstream in Low Power State ok n/a
maximumInterleavingDelayUs(10) 0x8B Maximum Interleaving Delay Upstream ok n/a
actualInterleavingDelaysUs(11) 0x8C Actual Interleaving Delay Upstream ok n/a
maximumInterleavingDelayDs(12) 0x8D Maximum Interleaving Delay Downstream ok n/a
actualInterleavingDelaysDs(13) 0x8E Actual Interleaving Delay Downstream ok n/a
accessLoopEncapsulation(14) 0x90 Access Loop Encapsulation ok ok
Net-Data-Rate values will be mapped into sheL2cpLinePropertySuboptions 0x81 and 0x82
variables.name: SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpLinePropertySuboptions

description: This parameter enable/disable special options for this ANCP interface.
Each requested option should be enabled by setting the corresponding BIT to 1.
cliSlotNumbers -> Use the same slot number in the cirtuit-id as used by CLI.
noVlanIdOrVcc -> Do not add VLAN-ID or VCC in circuit-id.
partitionId0 -> Use partition 0 in all messages independend of configured partition.
fixVlanid -> Use the fix configured VlanId value sheL2cpVlanId in circuit-id.
variables.name: SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpInterfaceOptions

description: Use this VLAN ID in the circuit id for all Ethnert based DSL ports if the L2cpInterfaceOption
variables.name: SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpVlanId

description: Defines the protocol version to be used on this interface.
(Not supported in R4.7.1M; Supported from R4.7.2M)
variables.name: SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpProtocolVersion

description: As long as there is no TCP session for that ANCP interface
established, MAC address and IP address are still unknown.
variables.name: SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpSenderNameOption

description: Used to define a sender name manually.
variables.name: SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpCustomSenderName

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpControlTimeStamp

description: The index of a port in the port partition table (vshL2cpPortPartitionTable) if the
PartionId should be set or the index of a valid L2cpIf in the sheL2cpIfTable for
modify or delete of these interface.
variables.name: SHE-L2CP-MIB::sheL2cpControlIndex
